event.name: MANTIS_VAMPWEED_CURIOUS
event.text: You receive a hail from a station at this beacon. "You Renegade? Having contact with Vampweed Confederation? We curious about them!"

The Mantises are in awe that the Premier himself is aboard your ship. Ivar regales the Mantises with his own exploits, leading to a good time for all. When he returns to your ship, he's carrying a bottle of wine he didn't have when he left.
The Mantises give you a complementary weapon for your time. They seem happy to have had a discussion with the premier.

choice.text: (Ty E'Rel) The Vampweed-Floral Ambassador has some things to say.

event.text: Ty E'Rel nods. "Yes, I can tell you about many historical events that I was there for. Are you more interested in the Vikikikikikipa-Te'Non Accord or the Grainery Pact?" After Ty E'Rel tells a number of stories the Mantises give you a gift.
The Mantises give you a complementary weapon for your time. "Ty E'Rel wanted by Bishop... Very angry. But we not Bishop."

choice.text: (Mayeb) Mayeb has some little-known insight on the Vampweeds.

event.text: The Mantises are unfamiliar with Mayeb, but she is more than capable of answering the questions that they have. The Mantises are grateful for her time.

choice.text: (Alkali) Alkali is the leading non-Orchid expert on Vampweeds.

event.text: Alkali launches into a lecture about the history of the Vampweeds from a Shell perspective. No stranger to symposiums of all kinds, he manages to give them a lecture that even the Mantis layperson can appreciate.

choice.text: (Cultivator Crew) Your Vampweed is eager to fulfill their curiosity, for a price.

event.text: Your Vampweed is more than happy to spend some time conversing with the Mantises, regaling them of seldom-told tales and fun facts that haven't made it to the Hive. When your Vampweed returns to the ship, it's obvious they're a little drunk.
The Mantises were impressed by the elite Cultivator abilities, and included an extra gift.

choice.text: (Vampweed Crew) Your Vampweed is eager to fulfill their curiosity, for a price.

event.text: Your Vampweed is more than happy to spend some time conversing with the Mantises, regaling them of seldom-told tales and fun facts that haven't made it to the Hive. When your Vampweed returns to the ship, it's obvious they're a little drunk.

choice.text: (Caretaker Crew) Your Orchid knows a thing or two.

event.text: Your Orchid tells tales about the conflict between the different subspecies, and their shared history. The Mantises ask a few questions that the Caretaker is capable of answering. They grant you a polite reward for your time.

choice.text: (Praetor Crew) Your Orchid knows a thing or two.

event.text: Your Orchid tells tales about the conflict between the different subspecies, and their shared history. The Mantises ask a few questions that the Praetor is capable of answering. They grant you a polite reward for your time.

choice.text: (Floral Crew) Your Orchid knows a thing or two.

event.text: Your Orchid tells tales about the conflict between the different subspecies, and their shared history. It's not what the Mantises were looking for, but they give you a small reward anyway.

choice.text: (Shell Scientist Crew) Talk to them about the Shell's dealings with Vampweeds.

event.text: Your scientist talks about the history between the Shells and the Vampweeds, and about some interesting biological facts about Vampweeds. The Mantises start interested, but seem to become bored once the topic starts to turn to more scientific matters. Even still, they reward you for your time.
You impress the Mantises with the Vampweed technology that you carry on your ship. After examining it for a short time, they seem satisfied.

choice.text: Show them an Elite Spore weapon.

event.text: You impress the Mantises with the elite Vampweed technology that you carry on your ship. After examining it for a short time, they seem satisfied.
You impress the Mantises with the Vampweed technology that you carry on your ship. After examining it for a short time, they seem satisfied.
You do your best to explain what you know, but it's clear that your limited knowledge of the Vampweeds doesn't interest them.

choice.text: Apologize, you don't have any experts on board.

event.text: The communication ends, but there's still time to do something at this beacon.

event.name: MANTIS_WARLORD_MUNITIONS
event.text: As you enter this region of space, a Warlord ship comes out from the shadows, accompanied by a fellow Free Mantis Dropship likely filled to the brim with warriors. This might ordinarily be a threatening sight, but they warmly welcome your ship. "Renegade friend! We destroying Hive scum! Running low on missiles though... You have?"
"Not enough, but will manage! Maybe find Hive stash."
"One of our finest weapons! Killing many enemies with."
"Our latest kill! Proud of this one... hope has something good."
Rather than give them missiles, you instead train your weapons upon them. "Enemy spies! Both ships, attack!!" You're being boarded by the other Free Mantis ship. This will be tough!
"Understand! This place violent, will finding missiles elsewhere."

event.name: MANTIS_SLAVES_EXPENSIVE
event.text: There is a Mantis slaver here. On a hailing frequency, they display the contents of their dungeon, and the prices thereof. The prices are definitely not the usual accepted rate of a crewmember.
You acquire the slave. You can't help but feel you've been swindled, but you did agree to it.
You acquire the slave. You can't help but feel you've been swindled, but you did agree to it.

choice.text: Demand an explanation for their exorbitant prices.

event.text: You accuse the slaver of offering outrageous prices. The Mantis don't hesitate to attack you in response to your accusation.

choice.text: (Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a slave for a reasonable price.

event.text: The Mantis seems to blank out for a moment and then offers the same slaves again, this time for considerably cheaper.
You acquire the slave. The Mantis slaver still seems to be under the impression that they pulled one over on you.
You acquire the slave. The Mantis slaver still seems to be under the impression that they pulled one over on you.
You turn away from the slaver, giving them a wide berth.

choice.text: (Upg. Mind Control) "Convince" them to give you a slave for free.

event.text: The Mantis seems to think that you've already paid and asks which slave you want.
You acquire the slave. The Mantis slaver still seems to be under the impression that they pulled one over on you.
You acquire the slave. The Mantis slaver still seems to be under the impression that they pulled one over on you.
You turn away from the slaver, giving them a wide berth.

choice.text: (Mind Control Weapon) "Convince" them to give you a slave for free.

event.text: The Mantis seems to think that you've already paid and asks which slave you want.
You acquire the slave. The Mantis slaver still seems to be under the impression that they pulled one over on you.
You acquire the slave. The Mantis slaver still seems to be under the impression that they pulled one over on you.
You turn away from the slaver, giving them a wide berth.
You turn away from the slaver, giving them a wide berth.

event.name: MANTIS_GAMBLE_MV
event.text: This node is currently home to a Mantis leisure ship: a place of brothels and combat arenas for warriors to release steam. When they scan your inventory they indicate that you're eligible to engage in a grand game of chance.

choice.text: You don't gamble with crooks. Prepare to jump.

event.text: Better not to get involved in what's going on in there.

choice.text: Bet 50 scrap on the warrior with blue paint.

event.text: You watch over the view-screen as two Mantis juveniles are pitched at one another in combat.

choice.text: Bet 50 scrap on the warrior with red paint.

event.text: You watch over the view-screen as two Mantis juveniles are pitched at one another in combat.
The one in blue gets pressed into a corner, but he lashes out at the last moment, decapitating his opponent. You claim your winnings!
The blue Mantis seems sure to win, scoring numerous hits on his enemy. However, the one in red ends the fight with a single key swipe.
You transfer over the scrap that you bet and quit while you still have a ship to sail off in.

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Dodge the debt and power up the engines.

event.text: You are able to get out of firing range of the cruiser before they can react. However, a smaller ship breaks off from a patrol and moves in to engage.
The blue Mantis seems sure to win, scoring numerous hits on his enemy. However, the one in red ends the fight with a single key swipe. You claim your winnings!
The one in blue gets pressed into a corner, but he lashes out at the last moment, decapitating his opponent.
You transfer over the scrap that you bet and quit while you still have a ship to sail off in.

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Dodge the debt and power up the engines.

event.text: You recall the scrap you prepared to send and are able to get out of the cruiser's firing range before they can react. However, a smaller ship breaks off from a patrol and moves in to engage.

event.name: MANTIS_CAPTURE_SUZERAIN_COMMANDO
event.text: You come across an Engi wreck with one life-sign aboard; it turns out to be a Suzerain, and the sole survivor of the Mantis boarding party that wiped out the ship's crew. He's in no state to fight and he's brought aboard.

Your mind control device allows you to quickly get his story without resistance. It appears the boarding party was attempting to steal a weapon that the Engi ship was transporting. However their team was wiped out by drones.
You find the weapon in a hidden storage hold and decide to patch the ship up enough to let the Mantis leave.

Your mind control weapon allows you to quickly get his story without resistance. It appears the boarding party was attempting to steal a weapon that the Engi ship was transporting. However their team was wiped out by drones.
You find the weapon in a hidden storage hold and decide to patch the ship up enough to let the Mantis leave.
You help get the Engi ship up and running but take some of their supplies. He takes off without another word.
He takes your mercy as a sign of weakness and rigs up a small timed explosive before making off in the Engi vessel.
The Mantis Suzerain shows no fear as the airlock's inner doors are sealed and space prepares to take him. You press the switch and then he's gone, whisked out into the great black.
You strip the Engi ship before preparing to deal with the Mantis. However, the Suzerain immediately realizes your intentions and attacks!

It's not clear what occurs between the two Mantis behind the locked door, but when they emerge the Suzerain is prepared to provide telemetry on the local sector. He then leaves on the Engi ship. Your map has been updated.

After a short time alone with the Suzerain, you are told he wishes to join the crew. Although you are surprised at the Suzerain's willingness to swap allegiances, you trust your crewmember's judgement about him.

event.name: MANTIS_BROKEN_TELEPORTER
event.text: You're hailed by a Mantis vessel. "You not know how hard repair with claw is. Teleporter is broken, can you fix? We will pay you, as we are so kind."

choice.text: Agree to help repair their teleporter.
(Upg. Doors) Agree, but lock your doors tight in case of a trap.
(Repair Drone) Dispatch the repair drone to fix it. [-1|]
(Repair Burst) Use the bomb to fix the teleporter. [-1}]

event.text: As you dock your ship with the Mantis, they immediately come charging through your doors! Their ship turns hostile, and you should prepare for a fight.
Their teleporter does indeed appear to be in critical condition. It doesn't take long to fix it, and the Mantis pay you as promised.
As you dock your ship with the Mantis, they immediately come charging for your doors. Luckily they aren't able to break their way through, but you still have to deal with their ship.
The Mantis do not seem to be attempting to trick you, and their teleporter does indeed appear to be in critical condition. It doesn't take long to fix it, and the Mantis pay you as promised.
The Mantis are surprised to see a drone instead of crew, and it doesn't take long for them to reveal their hostile intentions. They cut up the drone and their ship turns hostile.
The Mantis's teleporter does indeed appear to be in critical condition. It doesn't take long for the drone to fix it, and the Mantis pay you as promised.

The Mantis are surprised to see your burst weapon targeting their ship. Whether they always had hostile intentions or think your Repair Burst is a real weapon is irrelevant, because the Mantis have turned hostile.
The Mantis's teleporter does indeed appear to be in critical condition. Your bomb promptly fixes it, and the Mantis pay you as promised.
"Fine. Tell truth, we lie. Now, we take supplies from you and make even better teleporter!"
The Mantis don't attempt to push further.

event.name: MANTIS_PIRATE_FAKE
event.text: A Mantis pirate ship defends this beacon, claiming to be one of the Hive's enforcers. They demand you pay them either scrap or a slave, or be obliterated.
You make it clear to the pirate that you have no interest in giving them anything but death. You both hurry to prepare for battle.
The Mantis seem satisfied and fly away, leaving you to grumble over your lost scrap.
The Mantis come aboard and pick one of your crew to take back with them. Your crew struggles, trying to free themselves, but the last you see of them is screaming, being dragged out of the ship.

removeCrew.text: Tempting as it is to clone your crew, you made the decision to give them up, and you aren't going to break Federation code for it.

choice.text: The onboard AI recommends terminating these pirates with extreme prejudice.

event.name: MANTIS_SLUG_TAUNT
event.text: A Slug and Mantis ship appear to be squaring off at this beacon, but weapons have not yet been fired. Both ships simultaneously hail you. The Slug speaks first, "Federation, how fortuitousss that sssomeone elssse who I'm ssssure will appreciate the humor of thessse feeble pea-brained Mantisss and their pitiful attemptsss at dialect!" The Mantis cuts them off, "You stupid ones! Listen, how you drag out s's. True sign of inferiority." Both ships eagerly await your input on the situation.

choice.text: Agree that the Slugs are superior.

event.text: The Slug points at the Mantis and laughs, but is cut off when the Mantis becomes enraged and powers up its weapons and attacks!

choice.text: Agree that the Mantis are superior.

event.text: The Slug grumbles as the Mantis gloats. Furious at your shot at their ego, the Slug activates its weapon barrels towards you!

choice.text: Can't you both just get along?

event.text: The Mantis and Slug glance at each other for a solid minute before they both simultaneously say "nahhhh", and fly straight towards each other, weapons blazing. You fly away before you get caught up in the fighting.

event.name: MANTIS_SLUG_TAUNT_MANTIS_WIN
event.text: The Slug cackles, his already massively inflated ego having been expanded once again. Though he clearly still thinks of you as inferior, he gives you some additional fuel along with the remains of the Mantis ship.

event.name: MANTIS_SLUG_TAUNT_SLUG_WIN
event.text: The Mantis lets out a cry of victory, and performs a strange ritual dance. They leave you with the remains of the Slug ship and fly away.

event.name: MANTIS_ALISON_CREW
event.text: You arrive just in time to see an unusually well-armed Engi ship destroying a small pirate craft. A teleporter signal is detected...intruder on deck!

A young Mantis in a charred uniform has teleported onto the deck. He begs for sanctuary from the Engi, and offers to serve in exchange for your protection. The Engi have already traced the teleporter signal and are offering a deal in exchange for the prisoner.

choice.text: Side with the fugitive and fight the Engi ship.
Agree to offer up the Mantis in exchange for a bounty.
(Mind Control) Ensure the Mantis is passive before you make a decision.

event.text: Thanks to the Mantis's simple mind, it is quickly subdued by the effects of your mind control.

choice.text: Side with the fugitive and fight the Engi ship.
Agree to offer up the Mantis in exchange for a bounty.

event.text: It was a trap! The Mantis manages to sabotage your engines before beaming away.
The Mantis expresses his thanks and prepares to help you fight his pursuer.
The Engi captain is delighted, and quickly arranges for the transfer of the prisoner.
Fury sparks in the eyes of the Mantis. He won't go easily, and causes serious damage before he can be captured.
The pursuing ship responds with a completely unintelligible message. The young Mantis jerks to attention and assumes a battle stance. It was a trap!
This was meant to be a trap! However, with the Mantis still under the spell, they're unable to do any damage and you take them down quickly. Seems a fight is still inevitable.
The Mantis expresses his thanks and prepares to help you fight his pursuer. You redirect the mind control from the Mantis and prepare to fight.
The Engi captain is delighted, and quickly arranges for the transfer of the prisoner.
Fury sparks in the eyes of the Mantis, but because of the mind control he is barely able to do more than cause a single scratch on your floor before he collapses.

The pursuing ship responds with a completely unintelligible message. It becomes clear this was a trap, but fortunately because of the mind control you're able to take down the Mantis and move onto fighting the hijacked ship immediately.
You prepare for combat.

textList.name: MANTIS_FIGHT_CHOICE
textList.text: You're greeted by a rare sight: a Mantis ship that appears not to have noticed you.
For once, you see the Mantis before they see you.
When they see the Mantis warship waiting in ambush at your intended coordinates, your crew is relieved to note you've jumped someway off the mark.
You overhear Mantis comm chatter: "Negative, I kill more humans!" You gulp noticeably, but luckily they don't see you yet.
You overhear Mantis comm chatter: "One on the right starting to rot. Take him down. Take off fingers. Put out of airlock." They certainly don't seem to be friendly...
You overhear Mantis comm chatter: "Agreed. Next ship your turn. Good hunting." They don't see you yet.

event.text: You power down non-essential systems and wait for the FTL drive to charge. They either don't want to fight or have failed to notice your ship, the latter being more likely.
Before you have a chance to slink away the Mantis ship notices you and powers up their weapons.
You power down non-essential systems in an attempt to remain unnoticed. It looks like they are about to leave when suddenly they turn and set course toward you, weapons powered.
You quickly cloak the ship and move out of immediate scanning range. You appear to have gotten away undetected.
You cloak and shut down non-essential systems. In a short time the Mantis ship jumps away, no doubt in search of prey.
You quickly cloak the ship, but not quickly enough. They spot you and move in to engage.
You frown, power up the weapons and prepare to engage the Mantis ship. Not today.

textList.name: MANTIS_CIVILIAN
textList.text: A Mantis vessel flashes past your view-screen, weapons and engines at full. A tiny blip on the sensor readout marks its quarry.
You spot a Mantis ship hunting in the distance.
A Mantis ship engaging a civilian hails you. Sparks fly about his cockpit as he yells, "Stay out this human! Else you next!"
Local sensors pick up two ships engaged in a heated battle. It seems the Mantis military ship will surely defeat its prey.
You pick up a distress call from a civilian ship. It's being chased by a Mantis ship!

textList.name: MANTIS_CIVILIAN_AVOID
textList.text: Smoking, the civilian ship limps on. You set your sights on the future.
The noise of the FTL spinning up almost drowns out the explosions. Almost.
You let them pass and try not to think about it.

event.name: MANTIS_CREW
event.text: You detect and retrieve an escape pod floating nearby. You consider returning it to space when you learn it's Mantis.
You send the pod back out the airlock. You're not stupid.

choice.text: There's no way you're risking opening this pod without anyone around.
(Adv. Sensors) Access the interior footage of the pod.
(Shell Crew) Have your Shell open the pod.
(Rock Crew) Have your Rock open the pod.
(Obelisk Crew) Have your Obelisk open the pod.

event.text: The footage shows the interior of the pod contains a rabid, aggitated Mantis. Knowing that opening it will only result in disaster, you opt to jettison it back out into space.

The footage shows a relaxed Mantis inside, anxiously awaiting their fate. Once you open it, the Mantis falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
The footage shows a human inside, anxiously awaiting their fate. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.
The Mantis inside is FURIOUS. He cuts the closest person in half with a single swipe. Kill it before anyone else is hurt.

removeCrew.text: The Mantis is shocked to see the crewmember it just slaughtered step out of the Clone Bay.

event.text: As soon as you open the pod, the Mantis inside falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.

As soon as the pod opens up, an angry Mantis lash out and plant their claws on your Shell, which immediately causes it to combust as a self-defense reflex, neutralizing this threat. Due to their body structure, your crew member doesn't appear to have received any fatal wounds.
As soon as you open the pod, the Mantis inside falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.

Your crew member opens up the pod... which releases a berserk Mantis that immediately leaps on your Rock. Despite the agitated state of their attacker, they appear to remain in control and lift the Mantis, before proceeding to slam that nuisance across the room, seemingly having not sustained any injuries from that attack. The crew isn't endangered anymore, but you'd better get to cleaning up the room after the bloody mess of that situation.
As soon as you open the pod, the Mantis inside falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.

The Obelisk slowly advance towards the pod, seemingly puzzled at how such a primitive device in their eyes can function. Once they figure how to activate it, a rampaging Mantis emerge, immediately lashing at them. The Obelisk appears to be mostly annoyed at their futile swipes causing little effect on their sturdy body, but eventually grows tired and disintegrate their attacker, with ashes being the only traces remaining of the intruder.
As soon as you open the pod, the Mantis inside falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.

event.name: HIVE_VETERAN
event.text: This beacon is home to a Suzerain ship. They hail you, "I too old for this. Days long since having fought in Mantis-Human war, invasion of Earth left many scars of body and mind. Let not fight here, needless bloodshed from pointless hatred gets nowhere."

choice.text: We will avenge all of those you killed!

event.text: "Ha, what did expect? Let us fight, so that he who dies here may go to bliss."

choice.text: (Mantis Crew) Convince the Suzerain to join you.

event.text: "You wish to form friendship? One, what, which lasts years come? Yes, accept I do."
The Suzerain keeps true to their word and doesn't chase after you.

event.name: HIVE_MANTIS_AUTO_SITUATION
event.text: A Mantis ship appears to be circling the area nearby the beacon. You intercept their conversation with what you assume to be their Suzerain leader, "No, no. We not yet kill living ship. We continue trying, but it hard without weapon. Last crew... suffocate. Quite unpleasant."

choice.text: Offer to kill the "living ship", whatever that means.

event.text: The Mantis are shocked that you have the courage to hail them, but seem open to your offer. They explain that the ship in question is actually an automated Rebel ship that is lost and has begun to attack Mantis settlements, and that they have been dispatched to handle the issue. "You need something special if want to kill living ship. Do so and we are grateful, and pay you. Better accept help from enemy, than decapitated by Suzerain Karazawaka."
"Good, yes this might work. Come, we show you to ship." They lead you to the Auto-ship, which is in the middle of tormenting a civilian Mantis ship. You prepare to fight.

choice.text: (Hacking Weapon) We have a hacking weapon.

event.text: "Strange, but this might work. Come, we show you to ship." They lead you to the Auto-ship, which is in the middle of tormenting a civilian Mantis ship. You prepare to fight.

choice.text: (Adv. Weapons) We have a superior weapon system.

event.text: "Good, yes this might work. Come, we show you to ship." They lead you to the Auto-ship, which is in the middle of tormenting a civilian Mantis ship. You prepare to fight.

choice.text: (Anaerobic Crew) We have crew capable of surviving in environments devoid of oxygen.

event.text: "Good, yes this might work. Come, we show you to ship." They lead you to the Auto-ship, which is in the middle of tormenting a civilian Mantis ship. You prepare to fight.

choice.text: (Missile Weapon) We have a missile weapon to bypass their defenses.

event.text: "Good, yes this might work. Come, we show you to ship." They lead you to the Auto-ship, which is in the middle of tormenting a civilian Mantis ship. You prepare to fight.

choice.text: We don't have anything special, but we're still just as qualified.

event.text: "No no! You not understand, this ship kill you if you not be prepare. You useless. Maybe Karazawaka spare us if we bring in dead Federation ship..."
You have no interest but to kill the Mantis ship. You power up the weapons and engage.
You suspect the Mantis ship must have seen you, but they make no attempt to pursue.

event.name: HIVE_MANTIS_AUTO_SITUATION_SUCCESS
event.text: "Surprising, we counting on you die, and we bring corpses back to leader. Still, this works too." You scrap the Auto-ship.
The Mantis grumbles. "Fine, yes this promised. Here, take this, and never speak this again."

event.name: HIVE_JAILER_CHOICE
event.text: The Hive often sends about Jailer ships to abduct invaders, a term that also includes you. Luckily, the Jailer here has not yet seen you. You could attack the Jailer to try and free its captives, or escape while you still can.
You move in to destroy the Jailer, knowing that you'll have to kill their crew if you want the prisoners to live.

Your crew, armed to the teeth, board the Jailer and quickly take down the Suzerain crew staffing it. With the jailers turned prisoners, you free everyone locked up who you don't think will kill you immediately.
The Jailer doesn't seem to notice as you slip away.

event.name: HIVE_JAILER_KILL
event.text: You've destroyed the Jailer, but unfortunately none of the captives survived the explosion. You scrap the remains and try to avoid the drifting corpses.

event.name: HIVE_JAILER_CAPTURE
event.text: The Jailer's crew is dead but most of the captives survived the fight. Most of them request to be dropped off as soon as you're out of the Hive, but one volunteers to stay behind and work aboard your ship.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_BISHOP_CHOICE
event.text: Those who are unlucky enough to encounter a Mantis Bishop are rarely able to tell the tale afterwards. The same might have been said for you, had it not been for the fact the ship here has not yet spotted you. There's still time to slip away if you desire.
You've decided to take a huge risk here and fight the Bishop vessel. Let's hope it pays off.

event.name: HIVE_SUZERAIN_COMPLEX
event.text: The Suzerains are chosen from birth by the Mantis Bishops to be trained as elite warriors in special institutions scattered around the Hive. One such complex has been set up on the planet nearby. If you had to guess, it's likely protected very well.
As to be expected, your weapons can barely even dent their defenses. The minute you start shooting, you alert them to your presence, and one of their finest guards is dispatched to destroy you.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Send a boarding team to sabotage the complex.

event.text: You have more important things to do than go raiding important Mantis structures.

event.name: HIVE_SUZERAIN_COMPLEX_WIN_STUPID
event.text: You've defeated the guard, but you know more are no doubt on their way. You quickly scrap what you can and leave.

choice.text: (Magnet Arm) Use the magnet to draw in some extra supplies.

event.text: You try to maintain a lock on your crew's positions, but not long after they teleported in you can tell the situation gets heated. You hear the distinct sound of flesh being torn open and screams, followed by static. You order your crew to hurry back, but one of them is missing. With no other choice, you flee while you still can, but one of the complex's guards follow in pursuit.

removeCrew.text: Your recently murdered crew stumbles out of the Clone Bay, still clutching their throat. Once they're sure their head is still firmly attached to their body, they rush to help defend against the guard.

event.text: You remain in contact with your crew as they journey through the maze-like, stainless steel hallways of the compound. Laying small handheld explosives wherever they can, your crew then hurry back undetected to the safety of your ship, where you remotely detonate the bombs. You can see the explosions shaking the building, and their defenses cave in. With no way to protect themselves from further attacks, they give in to your demands, and give over scrap and one of their Engi slaves. Upon interrogating the Engi, you learn that they have remarkably been able to pick up combat skills from watching the trainees, and you decide they will be useful amongst your crew.

event.name: DISTRESS_MANTIS_FLORAL
event.text: A Gathering vessel is desperately trying to evade a hostile Mantis. Currently, the ships are too occupied with each other to bother with you.
You move to intercept the Mantis ship, and it veers off to meet you.
The affairs of the other ships do not concern you at this time.

event.name: MANTIS_FLORAL_SAVED
event.text: "Many thanks, Renegade. I wanted to impress my Oro'Bache hosts on my next visit to the Confederacy. They love Hive wine so much, but unfortunately these Mantis don't seem to like us Ctl'Yae quite as much as them. Here, a token of my gratitude."

event.name: DISTRESS_MANTIS_DERELICT
event.text: The origin of this distress call is a drifting Mantis ship. It does not respond to your arrival. The ship seems to be undamaged, but life support is not functioning.

choice.text: (Orchid Crew) Send in your Orchid crewmember.
(Anaerobic Crew) Send in your anaerobic crewmember.

event.text: You're familiar enough with Mantis regions to know this could be some kind of ambush.
There is a single Engi on the brink of death. It seems there's no nasty surprise waiting for you.

choice.text: (Orchid Crew) Send in your Orchid crewmember.
(Anaerobic Crew) Send in your anaerobic crewmember.
We can't save them. Scrap the ship instead.

event.text: The Mantis ship has a normal complement of crew backed up by a Vampweed. This is definitely a trap.
You're able to counter their ambush. They don't seem to have time to fix whatever is wrong with their life support.

event.name: MANTIS_DERELICT_SCRAP
event.text: Derelict ships make for good scrap. You harvest what you can and clean the mess up.
As you make the preparations to scrap the enemy ship, it springs to life. It was a trap!
The moment your Orchid steps aboard, it becomes apparent that there's some kind of trap! They're able to make it back to your ship, but it looks like a fight is upon you.

It was a trap! Your Orchid is killed upon boarding the ship, which still has oxygen by virtue of the Vampweed stationed on the ship. The ship's life support turns back on, and it looks like a fight is inevitable!

removeCrew.text: Your Orchid stumbles out of the Clone Bay, a little flustered.

event.text: The moment your crewmember steps aboard, it becomes apparent that there's some kind of trap! They're able to make it back to your ship, but it looks like a fight is upon you.

It was a trap! Your crewmember is killed upon boarding the ship, which still has oxygen by virtue of the Vampweed stationed onboard. The ship's life support turns back on, and it looks like a fight is inevitable!

removeCrew.text: Your crew stumbles out of the Clone Bay, annoyed for having been fooled by this trap.

event.text: The moment your crewmember steps aboard, it becomes apparent that there's some kind of trap! They're able to make it back to your ship, but it looks like a fight is upon you.

It was a trap! Your crewmember is killed upon boarding the ship, which still has oxygen by virtue of the Vampweed stationed onboard. The ship's life support turns back on, and it looks like a fight is inevitable!

removeCrew.text: Your crew stumbles out of the Clone Bay, annoyed for having been fooled by this trap.

event.name: MANTIS_DERELICT_ORCHID_SAFE
event.text: Your crew finds the struggling Engi slave on board. The natural production of oxygen manages to stabilize the Engi's condition long enough to get them back to your ship. "Renegade has: good timing. O2 sabotage: worked. Can offer: assistance."

event.name: MANTIS_DERELICT_NO2_SAFE
event.text: Your crew finds the struggling Engi slave on board. Unfortunately, it takes them time to bring it back to the ship. The Engi won't survive unless medical intervention is taken.

choice.text: (Upg. Clone Bay) Enter the Engi into the clone bay.

event.text: You quickly aim a healing bomb at the Engi, which proves effective at stabilizing their condition.

choice.text: We can't save them. Scrap the ship instead.

event.name: MANTIS_DERELICT_REFILL
event.text: You connect your powerful life support to the Mantis ship and refill it as fast as you can. The remaining Engi on board manages to catch its breath. "Renegade has: good timing. O2 sabotage: worked. Can offer: assistance."

event.name: MANTIS_DERELICT_ENGI_SAVE
event.text: "Renegade has: good timing. O2 sabotage: worked. Can offer: assistance."
You connect your powerful life support to the Mantis ship, but as you do, the ship springs to life, and the Mantis take this opportunity to board!
The ship doesn't make any sudden movements. If it is a trap, then it'll be someone else's problem.
As you try to leave it behind, their life support comes back online and they immediately pursue you. It's a fight!

event.name: DISTRESS_SUZERAIN_WARRING
event.text: As you arrive, it looks like a battle is coming to a close - a Mantis attack force led by a Suzerain is chasing some stragglers of a smaller clan. Over an open channel, the winning Suzerain makes a declaration. "Tikinakariiika clan is strongest! All ships, exterminating Pafinakinaaalara forces that not yield!"

"Fool! Challenging Tikinakariiika is death sentence!" As you attack them, boarders from surrounding ships teleport on board, although many of their attack ships are still tied up pursuing fleeing Pafinakinaaalara-aligned ships.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Mantises from other ships are still boarding you!

choice.text: (Kaz) Challenge the Tikinakariiika in combat for the territory.

event.text:
Kazaaakplethkilik presents himself before the Suzerain. The posture he assumes belies a ceremony to it. "Strongest? Saying that in my presence, you must either kill me or surrender your territory!"
The Suzerain on the other end makes an opposing gesture, broadening their stance and displaying their arms before proceeding to perform an exotic display of intimidation and strength in some kind of Mantis pre-battle war dance. A display that most certainly drew the ire of the Suzerain before him. "Kazaaakplethkilik, not name it was being! You are being destroyed by me alone, proving Tikinakariiika strength!" All other ships, including the losing side, surround the battle to become your audience.

choice.text: (Bishop Crew) Demand a tribute from the warring clans.

event.text: The fighting pauses in recognition of the Bishop's sovereignty. The Tikinakariiika gift a large amount of scrap, and the Pafinakinaaalara a Mantis weapon. After the gifts are presented, the Bishop presides over the conflict, officially ceding the territory to the victors, but granting the losing side safe passage out of the sector.
Your Warlord disparages the skills of the Tikinakariiika, declaring that the Free Mantis are far stronger. Enraged, the full might of the Tikinakariiika onslaught turns on you. This will be tough!

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Mantises from other ships are still boarding you!

choice.text: Fight your way out, drawing as little attention to yourself as possible.

event.text: There are so many Mantis ships in the area that it's impossible to avoid them all. You'll have to fight your way away from this beacon!

With your cloaking, you're able to stay hidden from any of the ships that get close until your FTL drive is warmed up. The ships seem to be more interested in claiming the territory than they are looking for errant ships like yours.
Unfortunately your cloak can't keep you hidden the entire period, and one of the ships that is searching for stragglers discovers you!

With your cloaking, you're able to stay hidden from any of the ships that get close until your FTL is warmed up. The ships seem to be more interested in claiming the territory than they are looking for errant ships like yours.

event.name: TERRITORY_DISPUTE_NORMAL_AFTERMATH
event.text: "Being very grateful! Tikinakariiika our longtime foe... Very cruel, very nasty! Pafinakinaaalara owing debt... will follow!"

choice.text: Accept the grateful Suzerain onto your crew.

event.name: DEFEAT_SUZERAIN_TERRITORY_DISPUTE
event.text: You finish off the Tikinakariiika Suzerain. Their ship provides a healthy amount of scrap.

choice.text: Survey the rest of the territory.

event.text: Upon surveying your surroundings, you realize that the battle was over before you returned to this beacon. The Suzerain must have stayed around to wait for you... but it's too late for the Mantis faction that used to reside here.

choice.text: Turn your attention to the rest of the battle.

event.text: There is a shift in morale. The losing side - the Pafinakinaaalara clan - now has a second wind, as the Tikinakariiika retreat back into their own territory. You scrap the Suzerain ship as the tide turns. In the aftermath, another broken-down Suzerain hails your ship.

choice.text: Turn your attention to the rest of the battle.

event.text: With so much of the enemy forces focusing on your own ship, the battle becomes a slaughter once the Suzerain dies. The Pafinakinaaalara are able to destroy almost all of the ships due to their tactical blunder. In the aftermath, another broken-down Suzerain hails your ship.

"Assistance from a Free Mantis... not expected." There is a tense pause. "But not unwelcome. Tikinakariiika our longtime foe... Very cruel, very nasty! Pafinakinaaalara owing debt... will follow!" The clan offers to let you scrap some of the debris from the ships you enabled them to destroy, on top of offering to join you.

choice.text: Accept the grateful Suzerain onto your crew.

event.text: After your victory, the fighting ends. The remaining Tikinakariiika clan present you with a large scrap reward before departing from the space.

The Pafinakinaaalara perform a ceremony, pledging their allegiance to Kazaaakplethkilik in recognition of his victory. "This territory belonging to Kazaaakplethkilik now! At your service!" Now subordinate to Kazaaakplethkilik, the Suzerain joins you.

choice.text: Turn your attention to the rest of the battle.

event.text: Kazaaakplethkilik died during the ensuing fight. The fighting briefly resumes, but with the Suzerain of the Tikinakariiika dead, their forces are in disarray. The Pafinakinaaalara are able to chase away the remainder of their forces. In the aftermath, another broken-down Suzerain hails your ship.

event.name: QUEST_MANTIS_REFINERY_CONVOY
event.text: A convoy of Mantis ships are passing through this beacon, protecting a cargo ship. Upon noticing you, an escort breaks off and attacks!

event.name: QUEST_MANTIS_REFINERY_INVESTIGATE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Destination of a Hive cargo convoy.

event.text: You arrive at the destination beacon - it appears as though there is an ore refinery at this location. However, this beacon is protected by a Suzerain guard ship, which does not hesitate to attack on sight!

event.name: QUEST_MANTIS_REFINERY_FREE
event.text: The refinery is staffed with mostly Rock slaves. Their Mantis slavers gone, they ask for passage away from the refinery. Out of gratitude for their rescue, they offer the materials they've been processing as a reward. Some of the Rocks even offer to join.

event.name: QUEST_HIVE_FREEMANTIS_HUNTER
event.text: Free Mantis returning to the Hive that they hate so much is rare, so it is considerably shocking to see a Free Mantis ship that appears to be making minor repairs at this beacon.

The Free Mantis is ecstatic to see you. "Perfect day, how glad we are to meet you here, Captain! We have important information to tell you. Here are co-ordinates of Mantis camp we find. Do with what you want, we must leave soon and return to clan. Best of luck."
Though you doubt the ship poses a threat, you have no interest in communicating.

event.name: QUEST_HIVE_FREEMANTIS_HUNTER_CAMP

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Location of a Hive camp revealed to you by a Free Mantis.

event.text: A Mantis warcamp revealed to you by the Free Mantis is much smaller than expected. A single station surrounded by Mantis ships of different sizes orbits the beacon. They don't see you.

choice.text: Attack the station, knowing it will anger the other, much larger ships.

event.text: You fly towards the station, attacking its main infrastructure. One of the largest ships detaches to defend the station.

choice.text: (Cloaking) Sabotage the station while hidden by your cloak.
(Adv. Cloaking) Sabotage the station while hidden by your cloak.

event.text: Hidden by your cloak, you successfully manage to deal massive damage to hull, compromising the station. The explosions send the docked Mantis ships flying away, leaving you alone with the wreck.
You would have to be suicidal to attack any sort of Mantis camp, regardless of size. You fly away until you're certain you're out of their sight.
Hidden by your cloak, you successfully manage to deal massive damage to its hull, compromising the station. The explosions send the docked Mantis ships flying away, leaving you alone with the wreck.

You attempt to destroy the station, but your cloak gives out before you can successfully demolish the hull. The attack sends most of the docked ships flying away, but the station itself is still standing and not about to surrender itself to you.

event.name: QUEST_HIVE_FREEMANTIS_HUNTER_CAMP_WIN
event.text: In a rare display of cowardice the remaining Mantis ships make no attempt to fight you and flee. You scrap the hull of the ship you just defeated before moving onto the station.
With no ships left to defend it, the station gives into your demands and hands over more scrap.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MANTIS
textList.text: A Mantis military ship appears on local radar alongside the remains of a human freighter. Prepare for a hostile encounter!
A Mantis military scout hails your ship. "Foolish alien! You has stifled greatness for too long! You rue the day you back the Federation!"
A small Mantis cruiser is broadcasting a repeating message on a wide-band frequency, "Non-Mantis ship that enter territory are forfeit. Lower shields and surrender if value your lives."

You detect a small military outpost and a few freighters nearby. This mineral rich planet in an isolated location would be perfect for an illegal Mantis mining operation. As you consider your options, a ship launches from the outpost. Prepare for a fight.
You discover yet another unlicensed and uncharted Mantis colony. They certainly waste no time expanding their claims. A Mantis ship moves to intercept you before you can jump away.
A Mantis military scout seems to have just finished a salvage op on a nearby wreck. They have no time to waste with warnings and appear to wish to fight.
A small military craft hails you and a Mantis captain appears on your receiver. "All local colonies punished for Federation's transgressions. Submit to processing."
A nearby Mantis ship begins aggressive maneuvers. You prepare for the worst.
A stream of clicks and gurgling comes on the comm from a hostile Mantis scout. The universal translator might be on the blink, but his intent is obvious.
The Mantis ship is pleased to see you, and fires up its weapon systems.
You recognize the outline of a Mantis ship against the blackness. Engage!
Something red looms. It's the Mantis.
A Mantis vessel hails you. "Hail is merely distraction!" You notice their shields and weapons have come online.
You notice a flurry of laser fire glance by the port window. The Mantis are upon you.
The Mantis hail you. Their captain says, "I claim vessel for my clan. Good hunting!"
A Mantis female comes on the vidscreen. The females don't make it to authority unless they're particularly vicious. You power the weapons.
A Mantis ship with the markings of a warrior tribe breaks position and attacks!
A Mantis ship hails: "Ah! Fine prey. Fine prey! We honor with most eviscerating arsenal!" You sense a cloud to this silver lining and power the weapons.
Children on Earth are told terrible tales of the blood red Mantis invasion ships - much like the one bearing down on you now - which once threatened the planet. You order weapons free!
A youthful-looking Mantis captain hails. "You, prey, must know. Your death, Kaaazthwak's final kill before maturity. Kaaazthwak pay respects." Seems respects in Mantis culture are paid with lasers.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_MANTIS_SUN
event.text: Who knows why the Mantis would venture so close to a sun. Perhaps it makes for more of a challenge?

event.name: MANTIS_CHASE
event.text: You are immediately hailed by an impressive looking Mantis ship, "Ship make a mighty fine prize. Prepare for battle!"

event.name: MANTIS_CHASE2

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Tracked location of a peculiar Mantis warrior.

event.text: You catch up with the Mantis ship that escaped before, only to see them transferring their crew into an even bigger ship!
"Not YOU again! You know how much repairs going to cost me? Time to take the big guns."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MANTIS_HIVE
textList.text: If you thought Mantis were deadly in other sectors, nothing can match the rage of a Mantis when you've entered their territory.
Hive Mantis aren't very friendly, but now that you've invaded their hive they'll stop at nothing to destroy your ship. A furious Mantis ship spots you and attacks.
You're hailed by a Mantis ship. "Federation fleshsack? Here in Hive? You have death wish. Let me grant it!"
You're greeted by the sight of a Mantis ship scavenging the remains of the last poor ship to have intruded on the Hive. Their attacker moves in to make you the next example.
You receive a hail from the Mantis ship at this beacon. "You come to Hive, so you must understand that you shall not leave Hive!"
A Mantis ship moves in to attack, set on the defending the Hive from your ship.
It doesn't take long for the Mantis ship here to notice you. They hail you. "Federation not welcome in Hive! You know this, yet you come here. Prepare die."
Something red looms. It's the Mantis.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_SUZERAIN
textList.text: Suzerains are no force to be reckoned with. Unfortunately this beacon currently hosts a Suzerain, and they seem eager to reckon with you.
A Suzerain ship approaches, ready to attack! You hurry to arm the guns.

Suzerains are chosen and trained by the Mantis Bishops to be the strongest warriors in the galaxy. Unfortunately for you, at this beacon you find yourself squared off against one of the Suzerain's ships.
At the first sight of the cyan hull, you know the ship at this beacon is a Suzerain. You prepare yourself for a fight.
Suzerains utilize both drone and boarding tech to kill their enemies. You find yourself face to face with a Suzerain ship and have no choice but to fight.
You're hailed by a Suzerain warrior aboard the nearby ship. "Ah, Federation ship. You are first kill I make since I become Suzerain! I thank you, and welcome you to death."
A Mantis ship hails you, and you go pale when you see it is led by a Suzerain. "You are no coward, yes? Good, I look for challenge. I welcome challenge! Prepare for bloodbath."

event.name: ENCOUNTER_COALITION_HIVE
event.text: As the Coalition receives the backing of the Mantis Hive, their ships can often be found here. Not the kind to miss out on the opportunity to destroy a Federation ship, they attack.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_MANTIS_KAMIKAZE
event.text: You're hailed by a Mantis, who frantically moves around the room in circles before facing you. "The Hive's security compromised, your fault! Death is only way. I die, so that the Hive may live!"

event.name: ENCOUNTER_MANTIS_STATION_HIVE
event.text: A Mantis station appears to be positioned here. For what reason you don't know, but the station deems you a threat and fires in your direction, leaving you with no choice but to fight back.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_GUILD_HIVE
event.text: A Clansman ship is already at this beacon. They hail you, their captain snickering. "Oh goodnesss, a Federation ssship here? I come here often to harrasss thessse freaksss for entertainment, but thisss isss too good a chance to missss!"

event.name: HIVE_MERCENARY
event.text: You can't help but shake the feeling you're being followed through this system. After some time spent running basic scans on the surroundings, it becomes clear your suspicions weren't unfounded. A Bishop vessel reveals itself, though its weapons are offline.

A female Bishop appears on the screen, out of breath as if she had been running despite being on a spaceship. "You are a Federation Multiverse Vessel, correct? Please disregard informalities and past inconveniences, for her royal majesty Queen Leikonpliiinakra has a request for you. We cannot offer you the Hive's allegiance or promises of safe travels, but you shall be given esteemed honor of queen's thanks! And if you so insist, perhaps ample cash reward."

"In this territory, there is a hatchery for future Suzerains and Bishops. However, dangerous rogue defectors have taken hold of it. By order of the queen, the eggs must be secured and moved to a new location. I will transfer the coordinates of the Hatchery to you now. I hope to see you there."
"Disappointing stance, but I haven't time to protest. If you will not assist, then it would be my recommendation that you leave the Hive quickly before Leikonpliiinakra's forces discover you."
You're no man of patience, and even though this was likely something important, you've forgone that possibility entirely by making the first strike!

event.name: HIVE_MERCENARY_HATCHERY

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You've arrived at the Hatchery, but you don't see any sign of the other Bishop ship. There is, however, a massive Suzerain cruiser here. You aren't sure how to proceed.
The cruiser seems to have several Suzerains led by a Bishop. That messenger wasn't lying, this Hatchery must be important to deserve this much security. Time for a colossal fight!
Without the other Bishop, you can't be certain what the plan is. It's better not to take the risk and leave while you're still alive.

event.name: HIVE_MERCENARY_HATCHERY_TIMER
event.text: You happen to notice that while you've been fighting, the other Bishop ship has arrived. However, instead of coming to assist you, it has landed next to the Hatchery and begun to load its cargo with the eggs. It seems they have no intentions of sticking around, so if you want to confront them you'll have to quickly remove this cruiser!

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: If you can't neutralize the Suzerain Cruiser before the time runs out, the Bishop will escape with the eggs.

event.name: HIVE_MERCENARY_HATCHERY_FAIL
event.text: It seems you weren't fast enough - and now the Bishop has jumped away with the eggs! The Suzerain cruiser has noticed as well, because it immediately switches focus from you onto the trajectory of the fleeing Bishop and jumps away after it! Seems this was all just one giant ruse...

event.name: HIVE_MERCENARY_HATCHERY_WIN
event.text: The Suzerain cruiser has been defeated. The immense hull of the ship comes crashing down onto the planet's surface, though fortunately it lands in the nearby river rather than on the Hatchery itself. Below, Mantis workers and Engi slaves flee, but the Bishop ship has not yet finished loading their cargo.
"You survived? Impossible, but impressive! You fight as well as my father!"

choice.text: Why did you use us as a distraction? What's going on?

event.text: "I did not plan for a confrontation like this, but it is time I confess. I am Laiiikarkapi, the first female Bishop appointed since the founding of the Episcopacy under queen Riiipiokinith. It would seem I have failed her majesty Leikonpliiinakra, but it is greater service to Mantis-kind that I prevent these eggs from pursuing lives of warriors than serve my purpose and raise them the same as I was."

choice.text: Where will you take the eggs then?

event.text: "I have arranged plans. A Free Mantis colony, away from Hive, has agreed to take and raise them as their own. I have faith this will be a better home. I do not know what will happen to me after. It seems fate has it my death as traitor to Hive is certain - but a noble death it will be. That is not of worry to you. Be it may that I trick you, you have helped me greatly. I will show you how to gain access to the blueprints of the cruiser you have defeated today, so that your Federation might take advantage of its power."

choice.text: Offer to take her with you.

event.text: "Huh? You are serious? I would not normally consider, but... saving reality could mean pardon, and life in the Federation certainly is better than death in the Hive. Perhaps my legacy does not end here then. I will have my crew transport the eggs on their own. They are capable. I shall be with you momentarily, captain."

choice.text: Wish her the best of luck and carry on.

event.text: "Yes, may you having the best of luck as well. Perhaps you will hear news of my fate in the Federation some time soon..."

choice.text: Request her help in finding the queen.

event.text: "Huh? You are serious? I do not know what you are hoping to achieve, but it is certainly better than a certain death at hands of the Episcopacy. I will have my crew transport the eggs on their own. They are capable. I shall be with you momentarily, captain."

With Laiiikarkapi's directions and Kaz's plans, you should now be able to track down the Mantis Queen herself. This won't be easy, but who knows what you might able to accomplish if you pull this off. Make sure you keep Laiiikarkapi and Kazaaak around, as without them, you won't be able to find your way.

event.name: HIVE

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: This is it- the Mantis Hive. No wonder it's so hard to find, as the bulk of the city is located in a massive cavern underground. Thermal power plants are scattered around massive pits of magma and a large city stands in the center. Even from such a distance, you can see the royal palace...

choice.text: We have both Kaz and Lai, we can do this.

event.text: As you start to approach the palace, a Bishop guard stops you. "You cannot be here! You will regret stepping so close to her majesty's palace!"

choice.text: Have Lai talk it out with the guard.

event.text: "So you carry two traitors, yet you still wish to gain access to Hive? I would kill you on the spot, but the Queen has heard of dishonorable Kazaaakplethkilik's arrival and wishes to see him..."

You're ceremoniously 'welcomed' into the palace, and with some brief fanfare Leikonpliiinakra emerges, dressed in golden robes. By the way you see Kazaaak looking at her, she must be quite desirable for a Mantis. She pays little attention to you or Lai, instead flirting with the Mantis warrior by your side. After some exchanged formalities, she walks back into the palace and you are ushered to follow.

The next location you find yourself in is a long dining hall, its tables decorated in Mantis cuisine. At last, Leikonpliiinakra speaks to your group as a whole, and strangely well spoken for a Mantis at that. "As soon as I heard my darling Kaz had returned, I knew you would come here. Sit, and feast as much as you like. We will discuss whatever business you have come here for after."

You spend most of the feast in awkward silence, with only occasional conversation between Kazaaak and Leik. Eventually, things turn more serious. "I am not oblivious to Kaz's recent movements in Coalition space, but I have chosen to turn a blind eye to them. I can only expect that you have come here to negotiate the Hive's withdrawal from the alliance."

"Then I'm afraid that I both cannot do such a thing nor would it have any impact. Even if I were to withdraw from the Coalition, which frankly is an idea I would not entirely be opposed to, you would have to convince the Leikonpliiinakra of every reality to withdraw as well. You might not realize it, but the Coalition has secured many realities of its own. But regardless of this, the Hive is not in a position to cut ties with the Coalition. After the Federation-Mantis War our economy has been in ruin, and the industrial might of the Kleptocracy and Theocracy have aided us greatly."

With that conclusion made, Leik turns back to Kazaaak. "My apologies dear, but in your absence the Hive has not grown fond of you. Traveling in-arms with another traitor to the Episcopacy and a Federation Captain has not helped your image. I love you, but my role as queen means I must place the safety of the Hive first. It is clear where your line in the sand has been drawn, so this must mark the end of us. And I'm afraid there is another reason I have allowed you here: the capture of the fugitive you have brought with you, Laiiikarkapi. I apologize my dear, for it was my fault appointing you to this role. But such things cannot go unpunished. This is the last stop for all of you. I can at least promise you your funerals will be held with honor." Leikonpliiinakra stands up, and her guards draw their weapons. You hurry out of the palace just in time to witness a massive cruiser approaching to stop you! Seems it's time to fight your way out of here.
You are not prepared for this mission. Better to turn back now than risk going any further.

event.name: HIVE_BISHOP_WIN
event.text: The Bishop cruiser has been defeated. Clearly this ship must have had some importance, because without it the Bishop forces have scattered. From its wreckage you salvage a special weapon. With the knowledge Laiiikarkapi gave you with the Suzerain cruiser, you figure out how to access the ship's consoles and download its blueprints.
Your demands are not met, and you aren't certain what you expected. It's not in the Mantis code of honor to surrender, and especially not to a Federation ship.

event.name: HIVE_DESTROY
event.text: With its Bishop forces scattered and defenses damaged from the impact of the cruiser, the destruction of the palace does not take long. It's almost certain the queen was killed during the attack. You aren't certain what will become of the Hive now or its involvement in the Coalition, but your work here is done. More or less.

event.name: HIVE_LEAVE
event.text: This is not the day for genocide. Killing the Queen like this would lead to the collapse of the Hive, and for all its done the Mantis don't deserve that fate. No more ships attempt to stop you as you leave.
